subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution: North West Himalayas, Sikkim , West Bengal (Kolkata, Darjeeling), Karnataka , Tamil Nadu (Moore 1878, Kirti & Singh 2015 , as
M. congerens (Felder, 1874)
; Volynkin 2020a).

Remark:
Stigmatophora (Stigmatophora) rhodophila rhodophila (Walker, [1865])
(=
Cymella congerens Felder, 1874
) is distributed in Japan , Korean Peninsula, Russian Far East and China . Indian records of
M. congerens
belong to
M. artocarpi .
Remark: Reporting of this species from Assam is probably due to old literature only.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution: North West Himalayas, Meghalaya (Khasi Hills), North East Himalayas, Assam , Punjab , Tamil Nadu (Nilgiris), Bihar (Valmiki Tiger Reserve) ( Kirti & Singh 2015 ).

Remark: According to the current treatment (
Volynkin & Bucsek 2016
),
Miltochrista dasara (Moore, [1860])
is distributed only in Java & Bali . The South Indian records of
M. dasara
belong to
M. chromatica
and the Himalayan and North East Indian records belong to M.
undulata (Swinhoe, 1903)
.

Remark:
M. inflexa
is reliably known only from Himalayan limits. So the records from the South of Brahmaputar valley ( Mizoram , Meghalaya ) possibly belong to an externally similar species
M. Victoria
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remark:
Trischalis absconditana ( Walker, 1863 )
mentioned as Indian species from Nagaland was based on
T. absconditana ab abbreviata
Seitz which was synonymised under
T . absconditana
by Strand (1922) . However, abbreviata is now considered as synonym of
T. subaurana
by de Vos & Mastrigt (2007) , so,
Trischalis absconditana ( Walker, 1863 )
described as bornean species, is removed from this list.
Distribution: Meghalaya (Khasi Hills), Arunachal Pradesh , Sikkim , Manipur , Mizoram , Assam ( Kirti & Singh, 2015 ).
